original: 8. Abhejjaparisapañha
analyzed: a bhejja parisa pañha
translated: The Chapter about the Unbreakable🔽The Questions about the Unbreakable Assembly

original: “Bhante nāgasena, tumhe bhaṇatha—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena tumhe bhaṇatha
translated: “Venerable Nāgasena, you say that

original: ‘tathāgato abhejjapariso’ti, puna ca bhaṇatha—
analyzed: tathāgataḥ abhejja parisaḥ ti puna ca bhaṇatha
translated: the Tathāgata has an unbreakable assembly, and yet you say that

original: ‘devadattena ekappahāraṁ pañca bhikkhusatāni bhinnānī’ti.🔽Yadi, bhante nāgasena, tathāgato abhejjapariso, tena hi devadattena ekappahāraṁ pañca bhikkhusatāni bhinnānīti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: devadattena eka ppahāram pañca bhikkhu satāni bhinnāni iti  yadi bhante nāgasena tathāgataḥ abhejja parisaḥ tena hi devadattena eka ppahāram pañca bhikkhu satāni bhinnāni iti yam tam micchā
translated: Devadatta split the assembly of five hundred monks.🔽If the Tathāgata has an unbreakable assembly, then the statement that Devadatta split the assembly of five hundred monks is wrong.

original: Yadi devadattena ekappahāraṁ pañca bhikkhusatāni bhinnāni, tena hi ‘tathāgato abhejjapariso’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: yadi devadattena eka ppahāram pañca bhikkhu satāni bhinnāni tena hi tathāgataḥ abhejja parisaḥ ti tat pi vacanam micchā
translated: If Devadatta split the assembly of five hundred monks, then the statement that the Tathāgata has an unbreakable assembly is wrong.

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, gambhīro dunniveṭhiyo, gaṇṭhitopi gaṇṭhitaro,
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭiko pañho tava anuppattaḥ gambhīraḥ dunniveṭhiyaḥ gaṇṭhitaḥ api gaṇṭhitaro
translated: This too is a double-pronged question; it is deep, hard to probe, hard to understand, hard to see, subtle, and hard to comprehend.

original: etthāyaṁ jano āvaṭo nivuto ovuto pihito pariyonaddho, ettha tava ñāṇabalaṁ dassehi paravādesū”ti.
analyzed: ettha ayam janaḥ āvaṭaḥ nivutaḥ ovutaḥ pihitaḥ pariyonaddhaḥ ettha tava ñāṇa balam dassehi paravādesu iti
translated: Here the people are confused, bewildered, and lost. Show the power of your knowledge to the opponents.”

original: “Abhejjapariso, mahārāja, tathāgato, devadattena ca ekappahāraṁ pañca bhikkhusatāni bhinnāni, tañca pana bhedakassa balena, bhedake vijjamāne natthi, mahārāja, abhejjaṁ nāma.
analyzed: abhejja parisaḥ mahā rāja tathāgataḥ devadattena ca eka ppahāram pañca bhikkhu satāni bhinnāni tat ca pana bhedakassa balena bhedake vijjamāne natthi mahā rāja abhejjam nāma
translated: “The Tathāgata, sire, is one whose company cannot be split. Devadatta split the company of five hundred monks with a single blow of his hand, but that was by the power of the schismatic. When there is a schismatic, sire, there is no one whose company cannot be split.

original: Bhedake sati mātāpi puttena bhijjati, puttopi mātarā bhijjati, pitāpi puttena bhijjati,
analyzed: bhedake sati mātā api puttena bhijjati puttaḥ api mātarā bhijjati pitā api puttena bhijjati
translated: When there is a schismatic, a mother is split from her son, a son from his mother, a father from his son,

original: puttopi pitarā bhijjati, bhātāpi bhaginiyā bhijjati, bhaginīpi bhātarā bhijjati,
analyzed: puttaḥ api pitarā bhijjati bhātā api bhaginiyā bhijjati bhaginī api bhātarā bhijjati
translated: a brother from his sister, a sister from her brother,

original: sahāyopi sahāyena bhijjati, nāvāpi nānādārusaṅghaṭitā ūmivegasampahārena bhijjati,
analyzed: sahāyaḥ api sahāyena bhijjati nāvā api nānā dāru saṅghaṭitā ūmi vega sampahārena bhijjati
translated: a friend from his friend. A ship, too, sire, made of many pieces of wood fastened together is split by the force of the wind.

original: rukkhopi madhukappasampannaphalo anilabalavegābhihato bhijjati, suvaṇṇampi jātimantaṁ lohena bhijjati.
analyzed: rukkhaḥ api madhu kappa sampanna phalaḥ anila bala vega abhihataḥ bhijjati suvaṇṇam pi jātimantam lohena bhijjati
translated: A tree, too, sire, laden with many sweet fruits is split by the force of the wind. Gold, too, sire, though of pure breed, is split by iron.

original: Api ca, mahārāja, neso adhippāyo viññūnaṁ, nesā buddhānaṁ adhimutti, neso paṇḍitānaṁ chando ‘tathāgato bhejjapariso’ti.
analyzed: api ca mahā rāja na isaḥ adhippāyaḥ viññūna na isā buddhānam adhimutti na isaḥ paṇḍitānam chandaḥ tathāgataḥ bhejja parisaḥ ti
translated: Moreover, sire, this is not the intention of the wise, this is not the inclination of the Buddhas, this is not the desire of the wise, that the Tathāgata is one whose company can be split.”🔽“Revered Nāgasena, what is the reason why the Tathāgata is one whose company cannot be split?”

original: Api cettha kāraṇaṁ atthi, yena kāraṇena tathāgato vuccati ‘abhejjapariso’ti.
analyzed: api ca ittha kāraṇam atthi yena kāraṇena tathāgataḥ vuccati abhejja parisaḥ ti
translated: But there is a reason why the Tathāgata is called ‘one whose company is hard to break up.’

original: Katamaṁ ettha kāraṇaṁ?🔽Tathāgatassa, mahārāja, katena adānena vā appiyavacanena vā anatthacariyāya vā asamānattatāya
analyzed: katamam ettha  tathāgatassa mahā rāja katena a dānena vā appiya vacanena vā anattha cariyāya vā a samānatta tāya
translated: What is the reason here?🔽Because, sire, the Tathāgata has never heard it said that his company was broken up by any kind of conduct, whether by giving or by speaking unpleasant words or by doing harm or by not showing respect.

original: vā yato kutoci cariyaṁ carantassapi parisā bhinnāti na sutapubbaṁ, tena kāraṇena
analyzed: vā yatas kutoci cariyam carantassa api parisā bhinnā ati na suta pubba tena kāraṇena
translated: For this reason

original: tathāgato vuccati ‘abhejjapariso’ti.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ vuccati abhejja parisaḥ ti
translated: the Tathāgata is called ‘one whose company is hard to break up.’

original: Tayāpetaṁ, mahārāja, ñātabbaṁ ‘atthi kiñci navaṅge buddhavacane suttāgataṁ, iminā nāma kāraṇena bodhisattassa katena tathāgatassa parisā bhinnā’”ti?
analyzed: tayā apeta mahā rāja ñātabbam atthi kiñci navaṅge buddha vacane sutta āgate iminā nāma kāraṇena bodhisattassa katena tathāgatassa parisā bhinnā ati
translated: You should know, sire, whether there is anything in the nine-fold teaching of the Buddha that is not in accordance with the truth, and for which reason the Tathāgata’s company was broken up when he was a Bodhisatta.”

original: “Natthi, bhante, no cetaṁ loke dissati nopi suyyati.
analyzed: natthi bhante no ca itam loke dissati na upi suyyati
translated: “No, revered sir, it is not seen or heard in the world.

original: Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: Good, revered Nāgasena, so it is, therefore do I accept it.”

original: Abhejjaparisapañho aṭṭhamo.
analyzed: abhejjaparisapañhaḥ aṭṭhamo
translated: The eighth chapter.

original: Abhejjavaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: a bhejja vaggaḥ dutiyaḥ
translated: The second vagga on the company that is hard to break up.

original: Imasmiṁ vagge aṭṭha pañhā.
analyzed: imasmin vagge aṭṭha pañhā
translated: In this vagga there are eight questions.
